### Recent News
- Miles McBride ruled out long-term due to core muscle surgery, with minutes expected to shift to Jose Alvarado once available[3]
- Karl-Anthony Towns sustained right-eye laceration in recent game vs. Denver but returned after stitches[3]
- Knicks acquired Jose Alvarado before trade deadline from New Orleans[3]

### Additional Context
### Knicks Backcourt Depth and Injury Statuses

Miles McBride is out indefinitely following core muscle surgery performed on Friday (February 6, 2026), with an expected return in 6-8 weeks, potentially aligning with the playoffs; the official NBA injury report lists him as Out for Injury/Illness - Left Ankle; Left Ankle Injury Management and Core Muscle Injury[2][3][4][5].  
Jose Alvarado, acquired via trade from New Orleans on Thursday (February 5, 2026), is Out - Not With Team per the NBA injury report dated February 6, 2026, 5:00 PM, limiting immediate backcourt reinforcement[2][3][4].  
Josh Hart is Probable with Injury/Illness - Left Ankle; Sprain, positioning him as a key available option in reduced-depth rotations[4].  
This depletes Knicks' guard options, forcing reliance on Hart and others like Tyler Kolek or Jordan Clarkson for minutes typically filled by McBride's 12.9 PPG, 42.0% 3PT shooting, and perimeter defense[2][3].

### Impact on Offensive Efficiency vs. Detroit's Defense

McBride's absence removes a core two-way contributor (12.9 PPG, 2.8 APG, 2.6 RPG pre-injury, 43.4% FG, 42.0% 3PT), who provided spot-up shooting and on-ball defense essential for Knicks' perimeter efficiency and crunch-time play[2][3].  
Alvarado's unavailability delays his integration as a defensive replacement (career 8.1 PPG, 3.1 APG in 20.3 MPG), exposing backcourt to Detroit's #1-ranked defense without tested alternatives[2][3][4].  
Reduced depth strains offensive spacing and ball-handling against elite perimeter pressure.

### Karl-Anthony Towns' Status

No injury information listed for Karl-Anthony Towns in the official NBA injury report for Knicks@Pistons (February 6/7, 2026 matchup), indicating availability unless updated[4].  
Eye laceration not referenced in recent reports (searched through February 6, 2026); his status does not appear to impact this game's listed injuries.

### Additional Relevant Knicks Statuses for Game

OG Anunoby is Questionable - Injury/Illness - Right Toe; Soreness, potentially affecting wing depth[4].  
Dillon Jones is Out - G League - Two-Way[4].  
Detroit Pistons listings include Duncan Robinson Probable (Left Quadriceps; Contusion), Bobi Klintman Out (Coach's Decision), Dario Saric Out (Not With Team), and Tolu Smith Out (G League - Two-Way), with Jalen Duren unlisted (available)[4].
